page.title: 11CHILDRENS CLUBS.
page.content: A study carried out by children at Blackfield Middle School shows that there is a wide variety of organised clubs outside school hours available for children in the 8 to 12 age range. In fact they listed 26 different kinds of clubs, 60 in total, which fell into four main groups. 1st{youth {clubs;}2nd clubs associated with the { {scouting movement;}3rd clubs connected with some form of{sport;}and 4th{ {others.} Children can choose from 6 youth clubs, 4 cub packs, 2 scout troops, 3 brownie packs and 3 guide companies. Sporting clubs range from Judo and Kung Fu to Football, Tennis and Gymnastics. Other types of club include Drama, Ballet, a Wind Group, Majorettes and a junior Naturalist Club. Most take place in the community centres, church halls or sports centres.
